item.title: Europe floods: Rescuers race to find survivors as hundreds remain missing
item.description: A senior German politician has been criticised for laughing during a visit to affected areas.

item.title: 'Havana syndrome'-like mystery illness affects Vienna US diplomats
item.description: The Biden administration is investigating cases of so-called "Havana syndrome" among US officials.

item.title: Canada's vaccination rate overtakes US
item.description: Canada had a slow start on vaccinations compared to its neighbour but has now caught up to the US.

item.title: In pictures: Masks and social distancing at downsized Hajj
item.description: Only about 60,000 pilgrims living in Saudi Arabia were eligible to take part this year.

item.title: First Covid case reported in Tokyo Olympic village
item.description: The chief of the Tokyo Olympics accepts athletes are "probably very worried", after a Games-related organiser became the first person to test positive for Covid-19 in the athletes' village.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival: Titane wins top Palme d'Or prize
item.description: The outlandish Titane wins after jury president Spike Lee reveals the award in a ceremony slip-up.

item.title: Belgium takes back mothers and children from Syria jihadist camps
item.description: It is the biggest repatriation of suspected Islamic State members since its fall in 2019.

item.title: Iran protests: One killed in water crisis demonstration
item.description: Iran is facing a severe drought, and there is growing public anger over water and power shortages.

item.title: Covid misinformation on Facebook is killing people - Biden
item.description: The US president said a spike in Covid deaths among the unvaccinated was down to social media.

item.title: The migrants hunger-striking for legal status in Belgium
item.description: More than 400 go without food demanding a clear path to residency in Belgium.

item.title: 'Hollywood Ripper' Michael Gargiulo sentenced to death for murders
item.description: Ashley Ellerin, 22, and Maria Bruno, 32, were both stabbed to death in their California homes.

item.title: Daca: Obama programme for child migrants ruled illegal
item.description: A Texas judge says new applicants cannot be enrolled in Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals.

item.title: Under the skin of OnlyFans
item.description: A BBC investigation reveals concerns about how the site, known for porn, is structured and moderated.

item.title: Ros Atkins onâ€¦ the North America heat waves
item.description: Ros Atkins explains the link between climate change and recent heat waves in the US and Canada.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival 2021 highlights: Sun, stars and saliva
item.description: A-listers flocked to the Cannes Film Festival's red carpet, despite the pandemic.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: What's behind the violence and looting?
item.description: Some analysts say the violence wasn't spontaneous anger but a deliberate strategy of sabotage.

item.title: Covid-19: Second doses run dry in Brazil's scramble to vaccinate
item.description: Many are struggling to source their second dose of the Covid-19 jab in one of the worst-hit countries.

item.title: Week in pictures: 10 - 16 July 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Floridians rally in support of Cuban protesters
item.description: Across Florida, Cuban-Americans have been rallying to show their support for protests in Cuba.

item.title: Europe floods: Drone footage shows mudslides in western Germany
item.description: Houses have collapsed in the town of Erfstadt-Blessem following record rainfall.

item.title: Europe floods: Neighbourhoods clear up after record rainfall
item.description: BBC Netherlands correspondent Anna Holligan is in Valkenburg, where some residents have been forced to leave their homes.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The gymnasts 'building bridges between cultures'
item.description: The town of Murayama in northern Japan is preparing to welcome a team of Bulgarian Olympians.

item.title: Canada residential schools: 'Six years old, I was imprisoned here'
item.description: As searches for unmarked graves continue, survivors reflect on a dark legacy of residential schools.

item.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories: Why Hollywood stars like Ryan Reynolds are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John. Here's why.

item.title: Germany floods: Where are the worst-hit areas?
item.description: Maps, images and graphics showing the heavy rainfall and flooding that has caused widespread damage.

item.title: Germany floods: 'My city looks like a battlefield'
item.description: Witnesses voice their grief and horror at the deadly floods in western Germany.

item.title: Germany floods: How a country was taken by surprise
item.description: Amid the despair and mounting death toll, people are questioning how this could have happened.

item.title: In pictures: Chaos and destruction around Europe
item.description: Record rainfall caused rivers to burst their banks, leaving at least 122 dead in Germany and Belgium.

item.title: Science failed to predict extreme weather
item.description: Scientists want a super-computer powerful enough to accurately project the most damaging extremes.
